page.title: 10CROSSFORD SCHOOL
page.content: Crossford School was opened at its present site in 1973, previously sharing a site with Cairneyhill pupils. (see page 8) In 1984-5 the school educated {159}boys and {166 girls, in 11 classes, although a 12th class, plus a new nursery class, will have to be added in 1985-6. The school role has grown steadily from{227}in 1974, to its present total, as Crossford village has expanded, and now a staff of 11 permanent teachers, 1 teaching auxiliary, 1 learning support teacher, and visiting teachers of P.E., music, art, and stringed instruments, are required for the school to properly function. The pupils come from within a 2 mile range of Crossford, 170 staying regularly for school lunch, cooked on the premises, and 70 bringing a packed lunch. (continued on page 11)
